111121112112.content:
"I know, I'll ask some other superhero's what I should do! I'm sure some of them have been in this situation before and will know what to do!" Secretly, Peter hoped that they would tell him to keep being Spider-Man, and their advice would convince Mary-Jane to stay with him if that happened. Part of him, however, liked the idea of just having a normal job (maybe an inventor?) that would allow him to spend more time with his wife and child than his superhero career would allow.

The results of Spider-Man's search where surprising, to say the least. The hero started with the Fantastic Four. After all, if there was any one group that knew a lot about both being a family and superheroing, they were it. After speaking with all four adult members of the superhero family, they were in pretty much unanimous agreement that, as much as they were honored by the opportunity to help protect the Big Apple, they sometimes wished they could just be a normal family, with normal responsibilities. The thing still felt he would give anything to be normal sometimes, Mr. and Mrs. Reed wished they had more time to devote to each other, and their young son who had been caught in the middle of too many super fights already, and of course, Reed wished he had more time to devote to his experiments Even Johnny had gotten tired of the press badgering him every time he left the tower. None of the members of the team would give the web-slinger any direct advice, but they all insisted there would be no shame in it if Spider-Man decided to settle down and have a normal life with his wife and child. They could help pick up the slack. Before he left the Tower, however, Johnny Storm had to put in one last parting shot. "If you do decide to continue being a hero, you may need to drop a few pounds." The hot-headed hero poked Peter's small potbelly, which was quite noticeable underneath his skin tight outfit. " Or pretty soon, they will be calling you Spider Ham.!

The second source of advice came from Daredevil, a hero who patrolled the rough neighborhood called "Hell's Kitchen." Surprisingly, the blind vigilante agreed with the last superhero group he had asked. "You know, at the beginning of my career, I would have told you to stay a hero, but now that I have been doing this for a while...Let's just say I've never been close enough to anyone to marry them, much less have a child. That kind of love is rare and very special. If I were ever to get a grip on something like that, I wouldn't give it up for anything. At the very least, I urge you to consider your wife's proposal. I wouldn't want to bring up a kid while living the kind of life I do, you know?" Spider-Man nodded while he was suspended upside down by a web that left the hero dangling several feet in front of his blind counterpart on top of the apposite building. "Thanks for the advice, I'll keep that in mind." Before Spider-Man could swing away, however, the other hero coughed. "Um, It's probably none of my business, but from the level of strain I hear that web of yous is under...have you put on a few pounds?" Deciding not to dignify the question (the second comment about his weigh that day) with a response, Peter swung away for his last stop of the evening.

Over an hour later, Spider-Man landed at the Avengers Mansion out of breath after foiling a routine bank robbery attempt. Their had been no supervillians involved, but stopping the robbery had caused him more exertion than it would have a few months ago. It was official, his weight was already starting to get in the way of him being Spider-Man, which was a problem, since Peter loved his wife's cooking so much and Mary-Jane had basically forbidden him from going on a diet. It seemed even if he could force his wife to end her "superhero" ultimatum, Spider-Man would be too fat for duty soon if he stayed with Mary-Jane, his pregnant wife which he loved dearly. Pushing those thoughts aside, Spider man sought the advice of the one hero he admired above all others: Captain America. After having a long conversation with the Star Spangled Avenger that went well into the night, the oldest Avenger finally gave the Web-slinger some advice. "Look, you have to be your own man, and make your own choices. Being a hero is honorable work, and I would commend you for staying the course if you so choose. However, being a family man and looking after your wife and kid, that's honorable too. America needs good husbands and fathers as well as heroes. If you choose to retire, I won't blame you, and the Avengers will help pick up the slack." "Thanks Cap." The Scarlet hero had no wise cracks to make on this serious occasion, and was about to walk away before the other veteran hero added. "And by the way, If I had a wife that cooked half as good as yours apparently does, I wouldn't want to lose her either!" Suppressing a huff of indignation, Spider-Man cast a web from the top of the mansion, and took off,

It had taken him almost nine day to make his decision, but once he had, Peter Parker wasted no time in implementing it and immediately left for City Hall, where he explained to the Mayor he was retiring as Spider-Man. The mayor was not happy about it, but was somewhat mollified by the ex-hero assurances that other heroes would start patrolling the areas he had used to frequent. Spider-Man swung home, wondering if his Uncle Ben would be disappointed by his choice, and finally decided his uncle would understand. After all, in its own way, raising a family was a greater responsibility than being a superhero.

Mary-Jane appeared overjoyed by the Peter's decision, and made the former superhero an extra-large pizza with everything on it to celebrate the fact that the couple would be starting a family together. Surprisingly, Mary Jane ate none of it, opting to make herself a small pepperoni pizza instead. 'That's weird. I thought she would be eating more than me, now that she's pregnant and all. Huh.' However, not wanting to disappoint his wife, Peter forced himself to eat his pizza by himself. Surprisingly, it was not as hard as Peter thought it would be, as his wife cooking had been increasing his appetite over the last several months. Peter was still painfully stuffed afterward, but the delicious taste of the meal, and the belly massages that his wife followed it up with, was more than enough to convince the ex-hero that it had been worthy it to soldier on through the meal. Furthermore, Peter found that he was enjoying the feeling of having his stomach stuffed full to the brim more and more these days...

Over the next 9 months or so, Mary Jane...

choices: Some more time passes. Has the baby arrived yet or is Mary Jane overdue?

1111211121121.content:
...made sure that Peter was eating as much as she was.

If Mary Jane was being honest with herself, she was almost taking it as a challenge to see if she could get Peter's burgeoning waistline to keep pace with her own gravid, growing belly. A pipe dream, she had been sure but by goodness she had tried and was quite proud of her work. All kinds of pizza, burgers, hot dogs, pasta; she made it all over the past nine months and her cooking skills had grown if anything. More than half that delicious food had found a home in Peter's stuffed to the brim gut. Not that Mary Jane wasn't enjoying their large meals but her increased appetite was due to eating for two and while Peter's had just grown all the time.

Mary Jane might have felt bad about it if not for several factors. The first off, was that Peter deserved it. After everything he had done, had sacrificed, he deserved to be spoiled in a sense. Next, Peter repaid all of it. Even as she had been cooking up all manner of dishes, Peter had been busy attending to Mary Jane's needs. From arranging doctor's appointments to helping around the kitchen to just dealing with her occasional mood swings with a sunny attitude to setting things up for the baby, the ex-superhero had really traded on form of livelihood for another. All the while, as Mary Jane's belly distended with their growing child, she and Peter had cultivated a true food gut for the soon-to-be father.

Peter's stomach had become a domed version of itself and if one hadn't known better, they might have mistaken Peter for carrying the baby! For his part, Peter took it in stride. He'd fallen into the easy lull of just enjoying his and Mary Jane's new lifestyle. With his superhero troubles a thing of the past, Peter finally felt like he was experiencing the stuff he'd been missing in life. Not too mention that his superhuman strength and sense of balance meant that his bulging belly had little to no effect on his physical performance. Sure, it look quite a bit silly, what with a svelte young man with such a gut, but he'd been through so much that he truly didn't care. He'd found nothing better than to just enjoy a nice large dinner with his and then basked in the afterglow of such a meal, eventually falling asleep on the couch, stomach stuffed like a turkey with his lovely wife curled up with him. He was happy. Mary Jane was happy. They were expecting another bundle of happiness in the near future That was what mattered anyway.

Besides...he didn't think he could give up such wonderful food anyway....

He had left his bedroom window open to help cool the room down, but it was to no avail. As he flipped his pillow over for the umpteenth time, a gentle breeze ruffled the curtains and provided a much-needed escape from the balmy air. "Finally" he moaned, "now I can sleep". Peter then proceeded to flip his pillow yet again, and drift off into a deep sleep. However, as he lay deep in slumber, a mysterious figure crept through the open window and into Peter's bedroom. Unbeknownst to spidey, the figure had been poised outside his window all night, listening to every ruffling of the bedsheets and waiting for the opportune moment to strike. Now was the perfect time. As the shape crept closer to the bed, it pulled a syringe out of a pocket in it's labcoat. Once bedside, the creature hesitated for a moment while staring at Peter's face. Then, it quickly- but with great care -lifted spidey's exposed forearm up and inserted the syringe into it, causing Peter to stir and mumble something. Luckily, he didn't wake. During this momentary unrest, the figure didn't move or breath at all, for fear of failing his goal. Once Peter settled down again, the syringe was fully emptied into his arm and then extracted. The creature then gently laid Peter's arm down again and silently crept back out the window, scales glistening in the moonlight. As he reached up to grab some cereal from the cupboard, he noticed a small dot on his forearm. "Whats this?" he asked himself as he examined the pinprick. "Is that... blood? What the? It is!" he shouted. "Oh no, the window!" Peter then put two and two together and decided someone must have come through the window and taken a sample of his blood, possibly for some crazy experiment. With his face now becoming very pale over the realization of this, he quickly finished getting ready and donned his suit to confront the Doctor.

"Alright, alright, calm down Peter. Strenuous activity will only make it worse."
"Make it worse? What are you talking about?" With that, Spiderman tore his webbing away and grabbed Connors by his collar, holding him up against the wall with both arms. "You'd better tell me what the hell is going on or I'll web you up so tight it will take days for anyone to break you out, do you understand?" he growled.

What will Peter do?
